answers.feedback_html: The wavelength of EM waves decreases as the frequency increases.

answers.content_html: The wavelength first increases and then decreases.
answers.feedback_html: Frequency is inversely proportional to the wavelength of an EM wave.

answers.content_html: The wavelength first decreases and then increases.
answers.feedback_html: As the frequency of an EM wave increases, the wavelength decreases.
The wavelength is inversely proportional to the frequency of an EM wave.

stem_html: How does wavelength change as frequency increases across the EM spectrum?

answers.content_html: They are perpendicular to and out of phase with each other.
answers.feedback_html: They are in phase with each other.

answers.content_html: They are perpendicular to and in phase with each other.
answers.feedback_html: Electromagnetic waves consist of electric and magnetic fields that are perpendicular to and in phase with each other.

answers.content_html: They are parallel to and out of phase with each other.
answers.feedback_html: They are not parallel and are always in phase with each other.

answers.content_html: They are parallel to and in phase with each other.
answers.feedback_html: The magnetic and electric fields in an electromagnetic wave are perpendicular to each other.

stem_html: Describe the electric and magnetic fields that make up an electromagnetic wave in terms of their orientation relative to each other and their phases.

answers.content_html: Sunlight is converted into chemical energy by plants; this energy is released when we digest food.
answers.feedback_html: Plants convert sunlight into chemical energy by photosynthesis. This chemical energy is absorbed by humans when they digest food.

answers.content_html: Sunlight is converted into chemical energy by animals; this energy is released when we digest food.
answers.feedback_html: Animals cannot convert sunlight directly into chemical energy.

answers.content_html: Sunlight is converted into chemical energy by fish; this energy is released when we digest food.
answers.feedback_html: Sunlight cannot be utilized by fish to produce any by-product.

answers.content_html: Sunlight is converted into chemical energy by humans; this energy is released when we digest food.
answers.feedback_html: Humans can produce some vitamins by absorbing light but cannot produce any other substantial form of chemical energy.

stem_html: Explain how sunlight is the original source of the energy in the food we eat.
